item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, September 21, 2024 at 1:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Ultra high-resolution image of The Night Watch (150 points | 41 comments)
2. Kamal Proxy – A minimal HTTP proxy for zero-downtime deployments (65 points | 35 comments)
3. Visualizing Weather Forecasts Through Landscape Imagery (494 points | 52 comments)
4. The Collapse of Self-Worth in the Digital Age (49 points | 21 comments)
5. Show HN: Container Desktop – Podman Desktop Companion (378 points | 160 comments)
6. Critical Exploit in MediaTek Wi-Fi Chipsets: Zero-Click Vulnerability (162 points | 55 comments)
7. Linux/4004: booting Linux on Intel 4004 for fun, art, and no profit (491 points | 120 comments)
8. Nango (YC W23) is hiring fullstack engs to solve product integrations ( | hide)
9. Show HN: Put this touch sensor on a robot and learn super precise tasks (312 points | 56 comments)
10. Vaporizing plastics recycles them into nothing but gas (13 points | 4 comments)
11. CuPy: NumPy and SciPy for GPU (327 points | 95 comments)
12. I Like Makefiles (327 points | 289 comments)
13. Open source maintainers underpaid, swamped by security, and going gray (263 points | 235 comments)
14. How do archivists package things? The battle of the boxes (102 points | 15 comments)
15. Concord had a dev culture of toxic positivity that halted any negative feedback (57 points | 28 comments)
16. Infinite zoom art turned into a game so fun (30 points | 9 comments)
17. Cold war spy satellites and AI detect ancient underground aqueducts (40 points | 4 comments)
18. MemoRAG – Enhance RAG with memory-based knowledge discovery for long contexts (153 points | 27 comments)
19. Porsche's idea for a six-stroke internal combustion engine (83 points | 195 comments)
20. Counting Sheeps with Contracts in Python (3 points | 1 comment)
21. Sshfs for Windows (54 points | 21 comments)
22. Mitosis in the Gray-Scott model: writing shader-based chemical simulations (91 points | 24 comments)
23. Reactive Relational Algebra (141 points | 29 comments)
24. Apple Shares Full iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Pro Repair Manuals (182 points | 109 comments)
25. Training Language Models to Self-Correct via Reinforcement Learning (215 points | 86 comments)
26. Kubesafe: Never run Kubernetes commands on the wrong cluster again (40 points | 20 comments)
27. Inside Annapurna Interactive's Mass Walkout (102 points | 57 comments)
28. Show HN: Open-source text classification CLI – train models with no labeled data (63 points | 2 comments)
29. Tō Reo – A Māori Spellchecker (155 points | 30 comments)
30. Gaining access to anyones Arc browser without them even visiting a website (1261 points | 428 comments)
